Description: Two joined fragments of the belly of a broad Clazomenian painted pottery amphora. Parts of women dancers. Purple for front and bottom border of skirts. At the bottom of skirt, a purple stripe on the dark area.White for flesh and patterning on skirt.
Curator's comments: From the same pot as Pl. GB 590, 3-4 (BM GR 1888,0208.113.a-b) and 1888,0208,106.f. Perhaps from the same pot as Pl. GB 590, 1 (BM GR 1888,0208.73.a). The fragments from Tell Dafana seem to come from comparatively few pots, but such sherds as these do not allow convincing attribution. BSA xlvii, 131-CII.2.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 590, 3-4)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 149)
